Description: Pottery jar body sherd with red slip on outside and added white paint. Made from Egyptian clay in Middle Minoan II style.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Egyptian marl fabric, probably from western desert oasis. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 127
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A565.1)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.23) (p. 72)
